content.question: A string of negligible mass is wrapped around the rim of a solid disk that can rotate without friction about its center, as shown above. The string is pulled down with a force of constant magnitude <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for an interval of time <math alttext="delta t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the disk starts from rest, which combination of <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will result in the greatest angular speed of the disk?

choices.label: <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math><math alttext="delta t" overflow="scroll"><mo>∆</mo><mo> </mo><mspace width="-0.2em"></mspace><mi>t</mi></math><math alttext="0.10 newton" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math><math alttext="10 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math><math alttext="delta t" overflow="scroll"><mo>∆</mo><mo> </mo><mspace width="-0.2em"></mspace><mi>t</mi></math><math alttext="0.50 newton" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.50</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math><math alttext="2.0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math><math alttext="delta t" overflow="scroll"><mo>∆</mo><mo> </mo><mspace width="-0.2em"></mspace><mi>t</mi></math><math alttext="1.0 newton" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math><math alttext="1.5 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math><math alttext="delta t" overflow="scroll"><mo>∆</mo><mo> </mo><mspace width="-0.2em"></mspace><mi>t</mi></math><math alttext="5.0 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math><math alttext="0.10 second" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math><math alttext="delta t" overflow="scroll"><mo>∆</mo><mo> </mo><mspace width="-0.2em"></mspace><mi>t</mi></math><math alttext="1.0 newton" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math><math alttext="1.5 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
